The Value of High Places

by Mike Forsberg on 28 August 2014

Mike Forsberg describes the importance and beauty of high places in the Platte River Basin.

Touring the North Platte

by Ariana Brocious on 5 August 2014

Platte Basin Timelapse tours the North Platte Irrigation system (including Pathfinder Dam) with cameras in hand, to learn how water is managed between the mountains and the crop fields.

New Hire and Project Update

by PBT Team on 26 June 2014

We're proud to introduce Ariana Brocious, PBT's newest hire. Together the team will tell the stories of the various people, places and issues in the basin and bring its complex geography to life.

June Field Trip to the High Country

by PBT Team on 15 June 2014

The PBT team travels to the high reaches of the Platte River watershed to collect footage and service cameras.

Earth to Lincoln Podcast

by Sierra Harris on 2 June 2014

Michael Farrell and I were interviewed by Ellen Wright for 89.3 KZUM's Earth to Lincoln in early March. You can listen and follow along with the transcript!

A Line in the Sand

by Steven Speicher on 23 May 2014

This last March marked three years of collecting images in the Platte Basin. I like to think of this anniversary as a line in the sand, a turning point for what the Platte Basin Timelapse project is and can be.

This Is Where the Platte Begins

by Emma Brinley Buckley on 25 March 2014

Lake Agnes is the location for PBT's highest elevation time-lapse camera, an alpine lake nestled in the Never Summer Range of the Rocky Mountains of Colorado. It is also the beginning of the Platte River's story.

Nebraska-Not in a Coffee Table Book

by Emma Brinley Buckley on 4 March 2014

My first impression of Nebraska and an introduction to my research.

Brought to you courtesy of the Platte Basin Timelapse team! | 2014
